The 35 year old intern

08 Sep 2011

Nobody likes writing about themselves.  I took an informal poll this afternoon when I ran into a friend on the streetcar (that way I wouldn’t have to do the math on the margin of error.)   It can easily come across as dry or as a #humblebrag  (or just bragging) and for those of us who are big into the self-deprecating it feels a little naked. (Both my Twitter feed and Facebook accounts are anonymous.)

I have had more than one career; I’ve actually had several since I started working at 12 (I was a babysitter, and certified too).  I’ve worked in film, personal shopping, and retail and now I’m making another jump into marketing.  I’m not one of those people who has known their whole life what they were destined to do.  Except I have always had a passion for strange products and well done marketing.

The last time I was in an American supermarket I was compelled to take home a bottle of Mr. Sprinkles.  Wouldn’t you have loved to be in on that meeting?  I’m sure it happened sometime in the 60′s or 70′s ; it has to be some of my favorite packaging.

I also come from good union stock.  I was on my first picket line at 9 months; my Dad still has my picket card.  I’ve never been to Canada’s Wonderland because they kicked IATSE out in the 80′s.

I have a huge shoe collection (shopping problem) but I vote NDP and try not to support businesses that don’t share my values.  And when a friend (thanks Andreas!) recommended me to Hypenotic I thought it would be an excellent place to gain some solid marketing chops. And that is how I became the 35 year old intern, now let’s just hope no one tries the coffee.

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada, and if you don’t know what that is, it’s time you do. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
